pages.venda: Kale-kale, Phunguvhe na Khwali vho vha vhe dzikhonani khulwane. Vho vha vha tshi dzula vho takala, vha tshi tamba vhothe duvha linwe na linwe.
pages.english: Long ago, Jackal and Partridge were great friends. They lived happily, playing together every day.

pages.venda: Phunguvhe o vha e na vhufhura vhunzhi. Musi vha tshi ya u zwima, Phunguvhe o vha a tshi dzhia nama yothe a sa fhi Khwali.
pages.english: Jackal had much deceit. When they went hunting, Jackal would take all the meat and give none to Partridge.

pages.venda: Nga linwe duvha, Khwali a tshi vhona vhufhura ha Phunguvhe, a gungula nge a vona u sa fulufhedzea ha khonani yawe.
pages.english: One day, Partridge seeing Jackal's deceit, complained because he saw the unfaithfulness of his friend.

pages.venda: Kale-kale, Nungwi o vha a tshi dzula tsini na mulambo muhulu. O vha a tshi funesa u edela zuwa kha matombo a fhisaho. Nungwi o vha mutuku fhedzi o vha e na vhuṱali vhuhulu.
pages.english: Long ago, Tortoise lived near a great river. He loved to bask in the sun on warm rocks. Tortoise was small but he had great wisdom.

pages.venda: Nga linwe duvha, Phele a swika a tshi sea Nungwi. 'U a ṱoḓa u gidima na nṋe? Ndi ḓo u kunda lwa u ralo!' Phele a amba a tshi sea. Nungwi a fhindula a ri, 'Ee, ndi a tenda. Ri ḓo gidimela murafho u re kule.'
pages.english: One day, Hyena came and laughed at Tortoise. 'Do you want to race me? I will beat you easily!' Hyena said mockingly. Tortoise replied, 'Yes, I agree. We will race to the distant hill.'

pages.venda: Nungwi o vha e na pulane. O vhidza vharathu vhawe vhoṱhe, a vha vhea nḓilani nnyi na nnyi a tshi vha fhethu hawe. Tshifhinga tsha mbilo tshi tshi swika, Phele a thoma u gidima nga u ṱavhanya.
pages.english: Tortoise had a plan. He called all his relatives and placed them along the path, each one in a different spot. When the time for the race came, Hyena started running very fast.

pages.venda: Fhedzi fhethu hoṱhe he Phele a swika hone, ho vha hu na Nungwi a tshi ri, 'Ndo no vha hafha!' Phele a gidima u swika a neta, a wa fhasi. Nungwi a kunda mbilo nga vhuṱali hawe, a si nga luvhilo.
pages.english: But everywhere Hyena arrived, there was a Tortoise saying, 'I am already here!' Hyena ran until he was exhausted and collapsed. Tortoise won the race through his wisdom, not through speed.
